content:
Diagnosis
	1. Renal medullary carcinoma with SMARCB1/INI1 loss
	2. Sickle cell trait carrier status

Date of diagnosis
	January 2024

Treatment aim
	Palliative

Summary of completed treatment and relevant dates

Surgery
	15 Jan 2024 Right radical nephrectomy

Chemotherapy
	1. Feb-Mar 2024: Two cycles carboplatin/gemcitabine - discontinued due to disease progression
	2. Mar-Apr 2024: Two cycles MVAC (methotrexate, vinblastine, doxorubicin, cisplatin) - discontinued due to clinical deterioration

Current disease status
	Progressive disease with growing liver metastases and new peritoneal deposits

Current issues
	1. Worsening right upper quadrant pain
	2. Increasing fatigue and anorexia
	3. New onset peripheral edema

Summary of consultation

I reviewed [redacted name] today who attended with his wife. Unfortunately, his most recent CT scan from 25/4/24 shows clear disease progression with enlarging liver metastases and new peritoneal deposits. His performance status has declined to ECOG 3, spending more than 50% of time in bed. He reports worsening right upper quadrant pain requiring increased opioid doses, with current daily morphine equivalent of 120mg.

On examination, there is marked hepatomegaly extending 6cm below costal margin with moderate ascites. Bilateral ankle edema noted. Blood tests show deteriorating liver function with bilirubin 45, ALT 156, ALP 345.

Given the aggressive disease progression despite two lines of chemotherapy and declining performance status, we have had a detailed discussion about focusing on symptom control. [redacted name] and his wife understand that further systemic therapy is unlikely to be beneficial and carries significant risks.

Further investigations
	None planned

Medication changes
	1. Increased MST to 60mg BD
	2. Started dexamethasone 4mg OD
	3. Commenced spironolactone 100mg OD

Follow up
	1. Urgent referral to palliative care team - completed today
	2. Community specialist nurse referral - completed today
	3. Next oncology review in 2 weeks or sooner if needed
